website_summaries.verdict: These fabric arm floaties work just like the plastic ones, but they're more comfortable and easier to put on.
pros: Supports children weighing up to 30 pounds
Not as constricting as a life jacket
They don't scrape the arm like plastic floaties, and they slip onto arms easier than plastic
cons: Inflatable, so they can lose air
Hook-and-loop closure wears out over time

customer_reviews.title: Jerky Spawnspawn.
customer_reviews.text: My 2-year-old grandspawn is a jerk. No seriously. He will walk straight into a large body of water, without thought. He has no fear and a no concept of how to swim, just yet. The moment I get near any water, I keep my Granny eyes and these floaties on him. Voila, no unexpected chaos! Good quality and easy to blow up.
customer_reviews.author: L!zzy

customer_reviews.title: Great to use, not so great to inflate.
customer_reviews.text: As floaties, these are fantastic. Once they are inflated they stay on my daughter's arms nicely and comfortably, and allow her to feel more confident in the water. The reason I am giving them three stars rather than five, is that when I am trying to blow them up, the air comes straight back out the nozzle as soon as I take my mouth away. I solve the problem by sticking my tongue against the nozzle until I can block it with my finger until I can close the darned thing. And even this does not always work. It generally takes me three tries to get these inflated sufficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Knight

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Very durable they fit perfectly on my five-year-old son. My son is also autistic so sometimes he likes to just chew on stuff and not realize the consequences of popping a regular plastic swimmie. Leave already use them three times and they're soft on his skin I'm able to adjust them and he runs around outside of the pool like they're not even on him.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool
customer_reviews.text: Must have for the little ones! These are an extra pair for my 20 month old grandson who is fearless at the pool. The inflation valves are sturdy, the floats are comfortable for him, and they help keep his head clear of the water when swimming on his back or front. Of course it is a must that you start by swimming with the child and keeping a hand on them until they are comfortable with the use of the float safe items in the pool. I have not tried these in the ocean.
customer_reviews.author: Kalani - Newport Beach CA

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed as the 1st pair worked great without losing air
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed as the 1st pair worked great without losing air. This one however lost air within one of chambers within the first day. Now I will have to return it but the price went up by a few dollars so I will end up having to pay more to get it replaced. Not happy as I have been referring all my friends to get these this past summer. Not anymore
customer_reviews.author: Amanda A

customer_reviews.title: Love these SO MUCH MORE than the constricting puddle jumpers
customer_reviews.text: Love these SO MUCH MORE than the constricting puddle jumpers. My children learned how to swim in a week, and these help give them enough confidence and hold them up well enough and gives their arms enough freedom that they love to swim!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: These were a waste of money for my 2 year old. It wouldn’t stop him from falling forward in the water. We ended up going with a Stearns Puddle Jumper and now he can keep his balance/head above water. Much better!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: comparing to speedo
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for younger child(3yo), older child(6yo) has same idea armbands by speedo. comparing to speedo, these are "just ok"... I do not like quality of fabric, it's thinner and stretchier than speedo has. my speedo does NOT have adjustable Velcro bands, not really needed,as it could be regulated by amount of air in the floats... other then this, it's adequate quality for 1/2 the money of original product
customer_reviews.author: semolot

customer_reviews.title: Great quality & comfort!
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I wanted for a 3 year old toddler - very soft fabric, perfect fit, quality made, easy blow up valve, adjustable velcro strap. PERFECT!!! I highly recommend over Speedo and other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Twila Waugh

customer_reviews.title: Our 1-year old son loves these!
customer_reviews.text: Our 1-year old son loves these! They let him swim around completely unaided. We keep an eye on him of course, but he is an independent little swimmer now!
customer_reviews.author: VTMusicFan

customer_reviews.title: Happy Kid Happy Mama
customer_reviews.text: These water wings are very comfortable, easy to put on, and take off. They are easy to blow up and easy to store away when not swimming. These are perfect for kids And they work wonderful No more red marks from water wings.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Bought for 15 month old
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 16 month old. Other floaties would not work but he loved these. they kept him above the water and allowed him to kick around the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Justin I

customer_reviews.title: A little more freedom
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 yr old is learning to swim and these are perfect. He had a vest but with these they give him a little more freedom to move around and swim. Easy to put on and take off. Like the fabric, nice and soft.
customer_reviews.author: s payne

customer_reviews.title: Velcro doesn't last!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 2 year old because we had inherited an older pink version (same brand, just pink from 8 years ago that still work just as well as they did then) from his cousin that we loved. My son wanted "boy ones" (blue). I loved them for the first 3 weeks until after about a dozen uses the velcro is now completely useless and doesn't stick at all. My son won't use them anymore because they aren't secure. They fall right off without being able to tighten them with the velcro. Returned!
customer_reviews.author: ABSmith

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: They were too big and slid off because of the loose material. I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Anamari Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Best floaties for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and lasted all summer with a lot of use. They keep my 3 year old above water and are helping him learn to swim. So much better than the cheaper plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd old did not complain! He wore them at all times and left no mark. Great floties.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These worked great for the first 2 pool trips...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 19 month old son. They worked great in the beginning and I loved the velcro to tighten them to his arm, but after a few swims the velcro lost its stickyness. Blowing these up is difficult. As soon as you take them out if your mouth they quickly lose air. It was a race to get the plastic valve closed before they deflated. I am so disappointed in this purchase. I got better floaters at the grocery store for $2. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid to put the plastic arm bands on my daughter so I got these after a friend recommended them. Keep one in the gym locker and one at home for the hot tub. we call them 'arm balloons' and now my daughter at 2.5yrs has the confidence to float by herself and kick and do reach and pulls to me. couldn't ask for a better product. thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Megan E. Selitrennikoff

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much! The material on the outside isn’t plastic so it doesn’t pull or stick to my sons arms. Keeps him floating and don’t fall off in the pool
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived so fast! Packaged well. These are the best floaters as they are material, not plastic. And they have a Velcro strap to enable you to tighten them around the child's arm. My 4 yr old had these on for 5 min and was comfortable trying to swim on his own and loves them now---b/c he says he can swim now.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Don’t act as a float
customer_reviews.text: Awful, Wouldn’t stay inflated, velcro closure kept coming undone, n worst of all kept tipping him forward in the water...he’s 2 n pretty comfy in the water
customer_reviews.author: Susan A. Rosselli

customer_reviews.title: Great floaties!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the 18 month old boy I nanny for. It was tough finding swimmies that are his size, under 30 lbs. They all cater to 40-55 lbs and he is only 25 lbs! I like the fabric, I kind of dislike that their brand is FLOTIES and not FLOATIES because it looks like a spelling error on the floatie...but these are the best ones I could find in his little size!
customer_reviews.author: jeywhy4

customer_reviews.title: Best floties ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great floties, these are the safest and don't deflate like the cheap ones.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: They get inflate very easy with little effort, very useful for a 1-2 years old
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Morales

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Love the fabric cover whichh helps prevent chaffing and sweating. Works as expected. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: The Tommasinis

customer_reviews.title: I love these and so does my son and the clock ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these and so does my son and the clock does not scrape their arms like plastic swimmers do we grab these and took them with us to Florida so we wouldn't have to pack a life vest and they were a lifesaver
customer_reviews.author: Brandee E. Lacava

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: Worked just like they should and didnt run red Mark's on my grand baby's. He was 2 and didnt seem to bother him at all.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for us
customer_reviews.text: Unuseful . Took it for vacation for my 2 years old. Did not work for us. My son is 20 lb and this thing could not hold him in a pool
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: A winner!
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy is 29 lbs and these are perfect! He doesn't mind wearing them, and I'm sure that's because they're a soft fabric, not the rough plastic kind. They go on easily and keep him just at the top of the water, encouraging him to kick and paddle, which he does.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My two year old won’t wear anything but old school floaties
customer_reviews.author: LRae

customer_reviews.title: Wish it worked...
customer_reviews.text: So the armbands are awesome, they are soft and lightweight. However one of the ones doesn't hold any air so it basically is ineffective and can't be used so I will be throwing them in the trash, never used!! Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Combined with a life jacket, our son who doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Combined with a life jacket, our son who doesn't know how to swim was able to float around in the lake with us and started to learn to doggy paddle and float on his back. Soft sides much more gentle than the old school plastic ones we had as kids.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Not expected size for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: I thought they would be alot more softer and more sturdy on the arms but they seem to big no matter what
customer_reviews.author: cristy dellomo

customer_reviews.title: BOYS Floatsafe Flotie soft fabric armband floaties
customer_reviews.text: The name says it all. These are arm floaties but the great thing is they are fabric. For years we have used the plastic arm bands. They are miserable to put onto a squirming child. These are not only fabric, but they have velcro straps. No more tugging and pulling. Once inflated they easily slide onto the childs arm then you adjust the tightness with the velcro straps. They are great. Our grandchild, age 4, loves them and feels very comfortable getting into water with them on. We will definitely be using these from now on. Thank you for providing such a great product! Your service was quick and very efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great floaties!
customer_reviews.text: Work perfectly, easy to use and inflate and have held up amazingly well considering the number of times they have been used for the beach and the pool.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: SOFT, COMFORTABLE, GOOD FIT.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these arm bands along withsize lg. for my grandson. He is no longer afraid and will swim along with us. When he can swim better then the swim vest alone without the floaties will fit him for a few years. Right now the arm bands are very necessary!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: who did design it?
customer_reviews.text: My son is 18 months old and 24 lbs. Long and skinny. After fully inflating there is no room for arms. After release some air to make room for arms they do not hold my son above water. Who did design it?
customer_reviews.author: agnieszka

customer_reviews.title: Well work the purchase
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair purchased. 3 1/2 year old grandson LOVES these! I had to buy a second pair to keep at our house 'cause he wanted to take the other ones home to use at the beach, etc. These are well worth the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Lambeau1957

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product but a bit big for an 18 month old. Also hard to blow up. But better than most.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Kolodny

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Gives my son a little more freedom to swim vs the puddlejumper
customer_reviews.author: debs@thebeach.com

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: These worked really well and were good for my 3 year old. They looked a little big on but fit well. The only thing I didn't like is that the sand (we used it at the beach) get stuck in it and it's hard to wash out.
customer_reviews.author: T. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd set of Floatsafe floaties I purchased for my kids. The fabric exterior makes putting these on and taking these off easier than the standard plastic floaties. The kids think they are cute, which makes them want to wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin K.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and my son was swimming before the end ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality and my son was swimming before the end of summer. He is 6 could not swim at all before we got these.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: They are awesome
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson loved them and they don't hurt his arms
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Every kid needs a pair of these! No hassle and no pulling on skin.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: My grandson love them
customer_reviews.text: The soft fabric makes them comfortable much better than plastic. The bad part is that it takes awhile to dry them before putting them away. The floaties provide enough buoyancy yet they don't get in the way when using a kick board. They work very well and are priced right!
customer_reviews.author: J. Sasaki

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: The velcro doesn't stay closed and the floaties don't stay on without it. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: A Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Work great. A little larger than the prior ones I bought but my kid did amazing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan OConnor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great & doesn't hurt little arms like the plastic ones do
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Purchased twice. Returned and purchased and returned. First ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased twice. Returned and purchased and returned. First time one arm didn't inflate. The second time one arm stopped inflating after couple of uses.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted floaties that were going to be durable as well as safety tested, and i didn't mind spending a little extra to ensure that my two year old would be safe this summer. I was happy with how they fit and how they were adjustable. The fabric was nice and didn't have sharp plastic corners like the cheaper ones would get when filled with air and creased. They wont even deflate if the plug is removed, the plug has to be squeezed at the bottom to deflate. Did i mention a life time guarantee? I am very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: gretchenJ

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Fit really well, made well and haven't had any issues at all keeping them on our 1 year old grandson. Still keep hold of him all the time he is in pool but it helps me with his weight distribution.
customer_reviews.author: KnightXreader

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and safe
customer_reviews.text: They are great and safe for my second son. My mother bought the same floties for my first son and he used it from 1 until he was 4 years old. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nalani

customer_reviews.title: Wish these stayed inflated!
customer_reviews.text: We got these for a trip for my son and unfortunately they did not stay inflated, so we could not use them! Very disappointing. It could have just been our pair but this was our experience. A waste of our money. I wish the company would send us a new pair to try. We really wanted these work because we need swimmies like these that are more fabric like than plastic, since it seems like it would be more comfortable and less irritating on our child's sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppingmom

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Great for toddlers! I bought these for my one year old and three year old. They are soft and easy to put on. I plan on buyingm more next summer!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Paris Woodall

customer_reviews.title: Boy's Floatsafe
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! My great-nephew could put them on himself, and he is 2. They worked very well in the water for him. And it looks like he will be able to use them for a couple more years. They are very well made. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Eireyes

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Wings
customer_reviews.text: Comfy water wings that fit well and keep our grandson happy in the pool!
customer_reviews.author: Sweet boys' Mimi

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: These are too big for my 18 month old grandson. He is of average size for an 18 month old and these are sized from 1-3. They are very well made, seem very substantial, and I think by next summer they will work for him.
customer_reviews.author: fonts29

customer_reviews.title: ... the pool and they came as expected and worked fine. He felt comfortable trying to do some basic ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my 2 year old to use at the pool and they came as expected and worked fine. He felt comfortable trying to do some basic kicking on his own.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda K.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Good even for the 4 ears of ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Good even for the 4 ears of age kid. But not good to use on the beach. Sand stuckes inside the cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Ksenia

customer_reviews.title: Water wings
customer_reviews.text: They fit my 18 month old son great. The Velcro is kind of a pointless feature. The strap that is suppose to stick didn't even really reach when the floats are fully inflated. I have a problem with the valves not sealing and letting air out quicker than I can plug them up. I reported the problem to the company, and they sent a replacement pair immediately. Unfortunately, I had the same problem with the second pair. I think it may just be the way they're made.
customer_reviews.author: S. Verka

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: The 3 year old love them which was very helpful (sometimes kids feel uncomfortable wearing them). They are very comfortable and easily adjust to the size of the arm. I strongly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: MIU

customer_reviews.title: not for skinny kids
customer_reviews.text: i thought these water floaties would be better than the plastic floaties that are out there but these don't seem to do the job in keeping our son afloat. maybe it's because he's quite small (18 months and 19+ lbs.). i guess we can try again when he's older but from the reviews i had read, i thought these would be good for smaller kids. although they are easy to blow up and deflate, my son's arms seem to disappear within them and we can't seem to get them on tight enough to stay.
customer_reviews.author: tmg

customer_reviews.title: Thankful
customer_reviews.text: I had one set of these and really liked it for the little ones. I now have four little ones that need these and I could not find them in any of the local stores. So happy when I typed the brand in and saw that I was able to get them on line!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They're more narrow then regular swimmies so they'd be best for toddler arms.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: safety first
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my grandson for our waterpark vacation. He had much more freedom and felt safe and secure if he wandered out in deeper water. They worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Grama Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small arms
customer_reviews.text: This past summer, I needed floaties my boys could wear. One is 4 years old and 32 lbs. The other is 2.5 yeras old and 28 lbs. All floaties sold in stores were way too large, even the ones supposedly sold for the 2-4 age range. These on Amazon were perfect. Much smaller and better for thin arms. They stayed on okay, about as well as those things can. They never seemed uncomfortable to my boys.
customer_reviews.author: R B Edmo

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: these are great for my 5 and 4 year old boys. They are smooth not like the other plastic one.
customer_reviews.author: Tloudmouth

customer_reviews.title: I like the fabric
customer_reviews.text: They work well, baby jumped in the water and floated. I like the fabric, for my baby they are still a little wide (18 month old), but I don't know if smaller ones even exist/would be comfy for the baby at all.
customer_reviews.author: Yv

customer_reviews.title: Grat stuff
customer_reviews.text: I got them for my boys they 3 and 17 mo although theese armbands are bit heavier than plastic ones they are realy soft and feel good on the skin
customer_reviews.author: irene

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea
customer_reviews.text: A big improvement over plastic floaties. Do not scratch and pinch toddler skin. My kid love them. three more words!
customer_reviews.author: L. Forsythe

customer_reviews.title: Kids dream
customer_reviews.text: It'd great my 3 year old loved them it was her first time in a pool and they werr great solid product for any child
customer_reviews.author: john rafaat

customer_reviews.title: Soft Fabric Armband Floaties
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these floaties for my grandson. They worked well, but I anticipate they will work better next year when he is alittle older. The soft fabric is really nice, it dosn't leave red marks on his arms. The armbands came early and packaged very well. I was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Floaties - working well
customer_reviews.text: These match our girl's bathing suit - just saying. She loves them. So far there are no problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: MPD

customer_reviews.title: Great Swimmies!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I have had some for my little girl since last summer, and now that my son is big enough, I ordered the boy version for him. These are great, durable, and extremely comfortable. They are much better than the ones they sell in the stores where I live and they last for years. A friend of mine has had hers for her daughter for at least 4 years. I am very impressed. Responsive seller, too.
customer_reviews.author: MayOK

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love the soft material for my grandson! His mother was excited about it too! Delivery was fast and the product was great!
customer_reviews.author: shelli

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: My son really liked these floaties. They don't pinch, which is a plus, and the fabric is nice and soft.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: The seem great for kids a little older
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit my 2 year old adequately, they were too large. The seem great for kids a little older.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Fiorelli

customer_reviews.title: For small arms only
customer_reviews.text: Ok i got these thinking my son will feel comfortable being able to stay afloat but they barely fit on his arms and he is 2 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Acart954

customer_reviews.title: Velcro comes undone
customer_reviews.text: I really like that these floaties are small enough for my 18-month-old and he loves that he can "swim" in the pool like his older brother. However, the velcro, which helps the sizing, keeps coming undone and eventually the floaties move all the way down his arm, which is obviously a problem because they won't keep him afloat if they're down by his hands. They seem incredibly durable and perhaps when he fattens up some, it won't matter that the velcro comes undone.
customer_reviews.author: dsimone

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We used these on our two year old for his first time in a pool. The swimmies are soft on the arm, stay in place well and have a velcro attachment that can tighten/loosen the swimmie on the child's arm. Overall we were very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: H. Whitmore

customer_reviews.title: Go for the Puddle Jumper or Speedo jacket instead.
customer_reviews.text: They fit a 35 pound 3 year old swimmer, but truly, the Puddle Jumper is better for some chest support too. The PJ is good in the gentle Gulf as well as the pool, always under supervision, also the Speedo version of the PJ is Coast Guard approved--a better buy and success story. All the kids are doing well in the pools in Gulf in Florida using the Puddle Jumpers for 30-50 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: great product and little ones can even use it
customer_reviews.text: awesome floaties that are soft and comfortable to wear. my 2 year old loves them! Infact all of my children have worn them and they do great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flotie is ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: Floties are hard to blow up. The air escapes before you close the valve. They don't seem to be large enough to keep my 2 year old grandson afloat. It helps but it does not do what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: IG

customer_reviews.title: Soft and comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: Better than plastic type. Small size even fit a 16 lb baby. Would definitely recommend for 1st time little swimmers.
customer_reviews.author: eein93

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: These floaties worked out very well for my two year old. They are made of high quality plastic and the soft fabric covering keeps them from rubbing or hurting the child's skin. I recommend these for their ease of use, comfort, and quick inflation!
customer_reviews.author: C. roth

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my 16 month old!
customer_reviews.text: most wings were for kids 3 and up- but these worked perfectly for my little girl who was 16 months at the time of purchase and she still uses them now at 21 mos.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: great floatines
customer_reviews.text: These floaties are much heavier duty than the typical plastic ones, and the fabric is much more comfortable as well. They stay inflated week after week without having to add extra air. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: lsossen

customer_reviews.title: better than plastic ones
customer_reviews.text: better than cheapo plastic, fit on their arms, and don't pinch, nicely made, good floatation. fits my 4 year old son.
customer_reviews.author: Ihatemalls

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great purchase. These floaties last forever! And the shipping is super fast! Great service!
customer_reviews.author: Hanakapi'ai

customer_reviews.title: Boys Swim Floaties
customer_reviews.text: This product might be good for a very small baby, but there is no arm room when each side is inflated. I thought that there would be alot of room and the bands could be tightened with the velcro closure. I am inserting material and adding more velcro to make them fit. I cannot imagine how small a child's arms would have to be for these to fit. Maybe a stick figure...
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Do not stay done up
customer_reviews.text: These are indeed more comfortable than the plastic versions. Yet they do not stay done up, the velcro continuously comes detached on both arms. I am now shopping for a plastic pair.
customer_reviews.author: A. Daley

customer_reviews.title: safe and easy to use for beginner swimmers
customer_reviews.text: My 3 and 7 year old have quickly built up their swimming confidence with the use of this product. I love the fabric - very comfortable for the children, and you can inflate the floaties as much as you need to help the product fit the size of the child's arm.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Koch

customer_reviews.title: Good quality floaties
customer_reviews.text: These are good floaties. They hold the air very well and don't slip off as easily as some do.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Millette

customer_reviews.title: Veey disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike what the previous reviews said, these did not fit on my toddlers arms. Veey disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved these floaties for my son way better then the plastic ones
customer_reviews.author: fina

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, bu t I just wish you ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, bu t I just wish you could find kid things in solid colors. Why does everything kid-related have to be manufactured in grotesque patterns? But, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Gemmer
